title: Topsfield massage shut down over alleged prostitution, trafficking
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Police shut down FeiFei L Spa in Topsfield after investigating alleged prostitution and human trafficking.
Authorities from multiple agencies executed a search warrant at the spa, located at 461 Boston Street.
A cease-and-desist order was issued; the spa's lease termination is expected, with pending criminal charges.

title: Charlie Coyle thankful for Bruins tenure in first game back with Boston
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie Coyle returned to Boston with the Columbus Blue Jackets, reflecting on seven years with the Bruins.
Coyle played a pivotal role in Boston's past playoff runs and was traded in 2025 during roster changes.
During the game, Coyle received a warm TD Garden tribute, acknowledging his contributions to the Bruins.

title: Amid trying year, Olympic gold shone even brighter for Charlie McAvoy and his family
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy won Olympic gold with Team USA, celebrating a personal and familial triumph despite a year of challenges.
McAvoy faced significant injuries in the past year, including a shoulder issue and a fractured jaw, affecting his NHL season.
McAvoy played a key role in Team USA's victory, logging significant ice time and contributing to a perfect penalty kill.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com encourages readers to test their knowledge with a Greater Boston news quiz, available February 27, 2026.
The news quiz covers recent trending stories and events in the Greater Boston area.
Peter Chianca, Boston.com's general assignment editor since 2019, manages the local news quiz initiative.

title: An injury scare had a Providence goalie in net for the Bruins on Thursday
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Michael DiPietro was called up from Providence to play for the Boston Bruins against Columbus after Joonas Korpisalo was injured.
Korpisalo was removed for a concussion check after a collision but returned to help secure a 4-2 victory, saving 36 of 38 shots.
DiPietro, named 2024-25 AHL Goalie of the Year, played 6:03 and stopped two shots before Korpisalo returned to the game.

title: N.H. woman arrested for alleged murder of her baby following 11-month investigation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Hepay Juma, 26, was arrested for second-degree murder of her infant in Manchester, N.H., after an 11-month investigation.
The infant, named Baby Jane 'Grace' Doe, was discovered dead in Pine Island Pond on March 27, 2025.
Authorities doubled the reward to $5,000 in April 2025 seeking public help for the case, which remains under investigation.

title: Way overdue on checking a carâ€™s transmission fluid
author: John Paul
bullets: A 2006 Mazda3 owner had black transmission fluid drained and refilled twice; further flush recommended in 10,000 miles.
A 2019 Subaru Crosstrek owner was quoted $1,600 for repairs, including TPMS sensors and control arm bushings.
An ex-mechanic's 2018 GMC Denali 1500 showed low antifreeze level; advised to monitor and check for leaks if frequent top-ups needed.

title: South Shore school evacuated after snow causes ‘structural stress’ on roof
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Plymouth River School in Hingham evacuated due to 'structural stress' from heavy snow on the roof.
Students and staff were relocated to Hingham High School as a precautionary measure for safety.
Hingham experienced over 17 inches of snow during Monday's historic blizzard, causing stress on the school's roof.

title: David Ortiz changes his tune on Rafael Devers after previous criticism
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Ortiz has softened his stance on Rafael Devers after previous harsh criticism regarding Devers' tenure with the Red Sox.
Ortiz expressed frustration last season over Devers' defensive performance and refusal to change positions, leading to criticism.
In a recent podcast, Ortiz stated he supports Devers, acknowledging his growth and expressing admiration for his skills.

title: Gas leak identified as cause of Taunton explosion that displaced 8 residents
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A gas leak caused a Taunton house explosion, injuring two people and displacing eight residents, authorities confirmed.
Investigators are still assessing the exact source and cause of the gas leak that led to the explosion.
Community fundraisers have raised over $33,000 for the injured mother and daughter affected by the explosion.
